intro: Neosasamorpha pubiculmis, commonly known as the hairy neosasamorpha, is a rare and unique plant species belonging to the family Cucurbitaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which provide a distinctive texture and appearance. The plant typically grows in humid, tropical environments, often near shaded undergrowth in dense forests. Its flowers are usually yellow or green, with a structure typical of the Cucurbitaceae family, featuring separate male and female flowers. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
